str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.
From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To choose, prefer. Probably akin to airo; to take for oneself, i.e. To prefer.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From hagiazo; properly, purification, i.e. purity; concretely a purifier.
Wind, breath, spirit.
And, even, also, namely.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From alethes; truth.
